thread.title: Divided House Republicans see savior in Paul Ryan
thread.title_full: Divided House Republicans see savior in Paul Ryan - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Erica Werner, Ap Congressional Correspondent
title: Divided House Republicans see savior in Paul Ryan
text: Photo: Manuel Balce Ceneta, AP House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy of Calif. walks toward the House Chamber on Capitol Hill in Washington, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. In the unruly House, Republicans enjoy a near-historic majority, yet deep divisions between ultra-conservatives and more traditional GOP lawmakers have left them at a loss over who should be in charge. House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy of Calif. walks toward the... WASHINGTON (AP) — Endlessly divided, House Republicans pleaded with Rep. Paul Ryan on Friday to rescue them from their damaging leadership vacuum. But the GOP's 2012 vice presidential nominee showed little appetite for the prestigious yet thankless job of speaker of the House. House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy of Calif. walks toward the House Chamber on Capitol Hill in Washington, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. In the unruly House, Republicans enjoy a near-historic majority, yet deep divisions between ultra-conservatives and more traditional GOP lawmakers have left them at a loss over who should be in charge.
